description:
Chase the blue ball, kitty.
Busy?
Learn delegation, kitty, and make the waves of your mind chase it for you.
onLoad:
(async function() { const at='pointer';  await api.window([`These worlds function by their rules, and you impose your will on them through your `, [{tag:'i'}, `actors`], `.

You can tell which are yours.`], at, 6);  await api.window([`Like everything, actors have structural integrity.

When all is lost, you lose.

Don't.`], at, 6);  api.window(`Avoid this.`, 'hunter1', 4, .9), api.window(`Chase this.`, 'target', 4, .9) })()
onWon:
(async function() { const at='pointer';  api.levelSuggest('levels/tutorial/3.json'), api.levelSuggest('levels/x1/1.json'); 'TODO: Also suggest a few more non-tutorial levels. Once we have them.';  await api.window('You did it.', at, 3);  await api.window(`There is nothing more to know, and everything to experience.`, at, 6);  api.window([{tag:'button', onclick:`api.levelExit()`}, `Click this to return to menu.`], null, null);  await api.window(`Care to test your mettle, perhaps? Overcome an obstacle, maybe?

â€¦No?

Well, not like a computer can make you care. It only takes one mind-control cult for this to be illegal.

Ultimately, whether you choose to care about a world that doesn't force you to is up to you.`, at, 24);  await api.window(`Challenge time.`, at, 3);  api.levelLoad('levels/tutorial/3.json') })()
onLost:
const n = api['tutorial2 lost'] = api['tutorial2 lost']+1 || 0 
 api.window([`See what happens when you are lost.`, `When you are lost, you find another you, and keep going.`, `Get back to the fight, soldier.`, `You can do it. So get to it.`, `That score? Your reward. Maximize it.`, `Over and over.`, `Over and over and over.`, `Over and over and over and over.`, `Over and over and over and over and over.

Immortality.`, `Not through lack of death, but death unendingly irrelevant.`][n % 10]) 
 setTimeout(api.levelLoad, 3000)
